definition: to remain/to be left/to have as remainder
extra/surplus/remaining/remainder after division/(following numerical value) or more/in excess of (some number)/residue (math.)/after/I/me
value/(to be) worth/to happen to/to be on duty

sentences.english: This surplus value is you think is profit into your own pockets.
sentences.chinese: 這剩餘價值被您認爲是利潤塞入您自己的腰包了。

sentences.english: Capitalists use laborers' surplus value to make a fortune.
sentences.chinese: 資本家利用勞工的剩餘價值發家致富。

sentences.english: The relationship between surplus value and profit margin is a key issue in the transformation of values.
sentences.chinese: 價值轉形中剩餘價值和利潤的關係是一個關鍵問題。

sentences.english: The doctrine of surplus value is the cornerstone of Marx's economic theory.
sentences.chinese: 剩餘價值學說是馬克思經濟理論的基石。

sentences.english: Capital appropriates the surplus value, a process referred to as exploitation of labor.
sentences.chinese: 私有資本攫取剩餘價值，即對勞動的剝削過程。

sentences.english: It is dependent on exploiting the surplus-value of prolateriat.
sentences.chinese: 這跟剝削剩餘價值有關。

sentences.english: Marx points out, " the capital is the value bringing surplus value ".
sentences.chinese: 馬克思指出，“資本是能夠帶來剩餘價值的價值”。

sentences.english: He confuses the stakes with surplus-value.
sentences.chinese: 他把賭注和剩餘價值混爲一談。

sentences.english: Draw the linesillustrating which choice has the highest value for the consumer.
sentences.chinese: 在圖中指出何種選擇能爲顧客帶來最高剩餘價值。

sentences.english: Surplus value is alterable capital generation.
sentences.chinese: 剩餘價值是可變資本產生的。

pinyin: duo1 yuan2 wen2 hua4 zhu3 yi4

definition: toss a peach, get back a plum (idiom); to return a favor/to exchange gifts/Scratch my back, and I'll scratch yours.
loss (of sth through natural disaster, theft etc) (law)
